00030 #ifndef _ABSTRACTMESHREADER_HPP_
00031 #define _ABSTRACTMESHREADER_HPP_

00048 #include <vector>
00049 #include <string>
00050 #include <fstream>
00051 #include <iostream>
00052 #include <sstream>
00053 #include "Exception.hpp"
00054 
00055 struct ElementData 
00056 {
00057     std::vector<unsigned> NodeIndices;
00058     unsigned AttributeValue;
00059 };
00060 
00061 template<unsigned ELEMENT_DIM, unsigned SPACE_DIM>
00062 class AbstractMeshReader
00063 {
00064 protected:
00065 //    unsigned mNumNodeAttributes; /**< Is the number of attributes stored at each node */
00066 //    unsigned mMaxNodeBdyMarker; /**< Is the maximum node boundary marker */
00067 //    unsigned mNumElementNodes; /** Is the number of nodes per element*/
00068 //    unsigned mNumElementAttributes; /**< Is the number of attributes stored for each element */
00069 //    unsigned mMaxFaceBdyMarker; /**< Is the maximum face (or edge) boundary marker */
00070 
00071 
00072 //    bool mIndexFromZero; /**< True if input data is numbered from zero, false otherwise */
00073 
00074 public:
00075 //    AbstractMeshReader() /**< Constructor */
00076 //    {
00077 //        mNumNodeAttributes = 0;
00078 //        mMaxNodeBdyMarker = 0;
00079 //        mNumElementNodes = 0;
00080 //        mNumElementAttributes = 0;
00081 //        mMaxFaceBdyMarker = 0;
00082 //
00083 //        // We have initialized all numeric variables to zero
00084 //
00085 //        mIndexFromZero = false; // Initially assume that nodes are not numbered from zero
00086 //    }
00087     virtual ~AbstractMeshReader()
00088     {}
00089 
00091     virtual unsigned GetNumElements() const =0;
00092 
00094     virtual unsigned GetNumNodes() const =0;
00095 
00097     virtual unsigned GetNumFaces() const =0;
00098 
00100     virtual unsigned GetNumElementAttributes() const
00101     {
00102         // By default returns 0.  If a concrete class does read attributes
00103         // it needs to overload this method.          
00104         return 0;
00105     }
00106 
00108     virtual unsigned GetNumFaceAttributes() const
00109     {
00110         // By default returns 0.  If a concrete class does read attributes
00111         // it needs to overload this method.          
00112         return 0;
00113     }
00114 
00116     unsigned GetNumEdges() const
00117     {
00118         return GetNumFaces();
00119     }
00120 
00122     virtual std::vector<double> GetNextNode()=0;
00123      
00125     virtual void Reset()=0;     
00126      
00128     virtual ElementData GetNextElementData()=0; 
00129         
00131     virtual ElementData GetNextFaceData()=0;
00132     
00134     ElementData GetNextEdge()
00135     {
00136         return GetNextFaceData();
00137     }
00138 
00139     virtual std::string GetMeshFileBaseName()
00140     { 
00141         return "";
00142     }
00143          
00144 };
